content.description:
This route may be a new route, I have never seen any chalk or sign of climbing on it. If I am incorrect or you have any other information please let me know. 

  Sit start on the far left of the wall. The hold you start on always has chalk on it and has a loose piece of rock in it that wiggles but will not come out. Start here with your foot on the dagger like foot, stand up and grab the sharp crimp (the origins of the name). Once established here move your feet and go to the crimp up and right, then move your feet if you need to and go to the good top out. Once having your hands over the lip traverse right until you can rock over and top out.
content.protection: Pads are a must because of the sharp rocks below, a spotter is good to.
content.location: In the Entrance Boulders this shares a wall with Cavers Problem but starts on the far left side of the wall on the weird jug that always has chalk on it.

content.description: Sit start on the same hold as for Razor Blade Romance. Move right to the large jug on the rail of Cavers Problem and top out as you would for that problem. The first move is the crux because it is a big big reach to the jug. The top out is a little sketchy, so spot it well.
content.protection: Multiple Pads, and good spotters, there is some hazards so spot well.
content.location: In the entrance boulders, starts as for Razor Blade Romance and tops out as for Cavers Problem.

content.description: Sit direct for Cavers problem. Start half way in cave on a small left sidepull and a tiny right crimp V10 (original way?), or right higher on a gaston V8, then make a hard move to rail, and finish Cavers problem. Top out in "the jungle".
content.location: Middle of the cave down low

content.description: Sit start in the narrow cave with your hands matched on a right facing blocky hold. Pick some feet and fire up to the large rail above. Surf the rail left for a few feet, before toping out via the obvious crimps.
content.location: In cave formed by two boulders in the entrance boulders fairly obvious, it's on your right as you walk into the Black Jack Boulders.

content.description: This boulder is easily recognizable by its wave-like overhang and the cave created between itself and the adjacent block. This boulder provides a few hard classic lowballs and a handful of good moderates.
